-> Core Subjects: You need to be very clear about subjects of your interest or subjects you have mentioned in the resume. Technical Interview questions will be purely based on those subjects.
-> Projects: You need to thoroughly know every detail about the projects you have mentioned in your resume. Students were asked to write down the logic.

This is a pressure round which could be held or discarded at the discretion of the employer. The interviewer will try different ploys to frustrate you including doubting your answers, trying to confuse you, and showing aggression, but the trick is to remain unfazed. On the other hand, your interviewer could be pleasant and amiable in which case the stage becomes considerably easier.\n\n You could be asked just about anything in this round so keep your wits about you. Here are some questions which candidates have been previously asked:

-> What is your goal in life?
 -> Tell me something about yourself that is interesting and you haven’t mentioned yet.
 -> Why do you want to join TCS?
 -> Why should we hire you?
 -> Do you want to be a small fish in a big pond or a big fish in a small pond?
 -> If your Team Lead is not giving you enough credit for your work, and is often complaining that you are not working, even if you are, then what will you do?
 -> Tell me something about your family.
 -> Who are your role models?

The round is intended to assess aspects like cultural fitment and attitude, although technical questions, brain teasers or behavioral questions are not outside its purview. Keep your answers brief and to the point, stay calm, smile often, think your answers through, and don’t get defensive if you cannot answer any question.\n Here are some sample questions to help you prepare:

-> Introduce yourself.
 -> Why did you decide to become an engineer?
 -> What are your strengths and weaknesses?
 -> Tell us something about your extracurricular activities.
 -> What is more important to you, money or work?
 -> Are you willing to work overtime, night shifts and weekends?
 -> Are you open to the idea of relocating?
 -> What do you know about the recent trends in the IT industry?

The Online test consist of questions from various domains and an essay writing. This is a time based test and each section is allocated specific time. Different sections of the test are:

 Quantitative Aptitude
 Logical Reasoning
 Verbal Ability
 Basic Programming and Computer Fundamentals
Essay writing is given specific time and you have to write an essay on paper on topic provided to you. Topics may vary from current affairs to politics to abstract.

Below are the topics that are frequently asked in Wipro Written Communication Test. We are providing the topics asked in recent as well as in earlier drive of Wipro.
 Discuss, what are the factors to influence fate and life choice of those kids? Is it their environments, parents, society or something else?
 Lots of students wear a uniform. Do you think tutors should also have their special dress code?
 Students of high and elementary schools often are not allowed to use smartphones in those institutions. Is it right?
 What person from the past you would like to become a teacher in your university or college? Who should it be and why?
 Is it necessary kids to have any other duties at home except their homework? Use your personal experience to explain your point of view.
 Water disputes between States. How we can solve it?
 Social media effect on young people. Have we become slaves to our new creation? Express your views on this topic and give suggestion.
 The influence of my favorite movie/book on me. Express your view from any real life incident.
 What is the impact of genetically engineered food. Should it be sold in market or not?
 How globalization affects economy. Express your views on this topic and give suggestion.
 Religious Freedom. Is it good or bad? Support your point.
 Indian Model of Secularism. Use your personal experience to explain your point of view.
